original_title: Wasantha Mudalige and seven others granted bail
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); IUSF Convener Wasantha Mudalige and seven other activists who were arrested on Thursday (18) night during a protest, were released on bail.

The group was produced at the Mahara Magistrate's Court on Friday (19) evening, and they were released on a personal bail of Rs. 500,000/- each, and were also ordered to appear at the Kiribathgoda Police once a month.

The Student Union of the University of Kelaniya had organized a demonstration on Thursday (18) night citing that its Chairman Kelum Mudannanayake, and Activist Dilshan Harshan were in detention for 138 days.
The demonstration, that was scheduled to commence at 6:30 in the evening, got underway after 9:30 at night.
Sri Lanka Police, Riot Police, and Water Cannon Trucks were deployed around the University of Kelaniya and along the Colombo – Kandy main road ahead of the demonstration.
Thereafter, the university students proceeded to the Colombo – Kandy main road, and it led to a heated exchange.
